item.title: Japan’s Department Store Shares Lag as Tourist Splurge Slows
item.description: Once the darling of Japanese stock investors, department stores have lagged the recent broad market rally and could fall further behind as a strong yen dents tourist spending power.
item.dc:creator: Momoka Yokoyama

media:content.media:description: Shoppers in front of Mitsukoshi department store in Tokyo, Japan, on Friday, April 4, 2025. Japan's cabinet office will release a monthly consumer confidence survey on April 9.

item.title: Stocks Touch Record as Trade Deal Boosts Sentiment: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks touched a record high in a sign of firming risk sentiment after President Donald Trump said he reached a trade deal with Vietnam. Asian equity futures were little changed.

item.title: BitGo, Ripple Join Wave of Firms Applying for US Bank Charters
item.description: Payments and stablecoin firm Ripple Labs Inc. and crypto custodian BitGo Inc. have applied for national bank charters, joining a crush of upstart financial services companies seeking such approval.

media:content.media:description: Brad Garlinghouse, chief executive officer of Ripple Labs Inc,. in Tokyo, Japan, on Friday, Sept. 6, 2024. Ripple Labs aims to launch its upcoming stablecoin in the US, according to Garlinghouse.

media:content.media:description: The Goldman Sachs headquarters in New York, US, on Friday, Jan. 10, 2025. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on January 15.

item.description: After years out in the cold, special purpose acquisition companies are again positioning themselves as an alternative to traditional initial public offerings for businesses that have been left out of the nascent recovery in first-time stock sales.

item.description: Japan’s auction of 30-year sovereign notes Thursday is shaping up as a barometer of policymakers’ success in quelling debt-market turmoil that pushed yields on the nation’s super-long bonds to record highs in May.

item.title: Biggest Hedge Funds Extend Gains In Chaotic First Half
item.description: The biggest hedge funds added to their gains in June, sailing through the first half of the year amid global market chaos sparked by President Donald Trump’s tariffs and the Israel-Iran war.
item.dc:creator: Nishant Kumar, Katherine Burton

Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: Veronique de Rugy Speaks Out on Trump's Budget Bill
item.description: George Mason University Mercatus Center Senior Fellow Veronique de Rugy says the Senate version of the tax bill is 'highly problematic' and believes the legislators are not serious about putting the country on a sound fiscal path. She explains her concerns with Scarlet Fu on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Microsoft Layoffs Continue With Another 9,000 Cuts
item.description: Microsoft is cutting around 9,000 jobs in a second major wave of layoffs for the year. Bloomberg’s Brody Ford discusses the plan with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Accel Leads $35 Million Funding in Campfire
item.description: Accel Partner Christine Esserman explains why the company led an unusually large Series A funding round into AI-native enterprise software startup Campfire. She speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Citgo Auction Adviser Recommends Gold Reserve Bid
item.description: A court-appointed adviser is preparing to recommend a consortium led by Gold Reserve Ltd. as the best bidder for Citgo Petroleum Corp.’s parent company, according to people familiar with the matter, with a judge to make the final decision in the coming months.
item.dc:creator: Nicolle Yapur

media:content.media:description: The CITGO Petroleum Corp. Lake Charles Refinery ahead of Hurricane Laura in Lake Charles, Louisiana, U.S., on Wednesday, Aug. 26, 2020. Hurricane Laura is poised to become a Category 4 storm that could wreak catastrophic damage in Texas and Louisiana, bringing a life-threatening storm surge, flash flooding and destructive winds that could leave areas uninhabitable for weeks or months. Photographer: Bryan Tarnowski/Bloomberg

item.title: Figma Files for US IPO
item.description: Cloud-based design platform Figma has filed to go public in what could be one of the year's biggest initial public offerings. Bloomberg's Katie Roof discusses the plan with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
